title: Add a key for Box user id in rclone config section.
body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

https://forum.rclone.org/t/rclone-api-rcd-header-for-box-api/41372

#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

rclone v1.63.1
- os/version: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 10.0.19045.3324 (x86_64)               
- os/type: windows                                  
- os/arch: amd64                                    
- go/version: go1.20.6
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: cmount


#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

[Box Docs](https://developer.box.com/reference/) allow to pass a specific box user id documented [here](https://developer.box.com/guides/authentication/jwt/as-user/). Currently rclone is using `"_config":{"Headers": [{"Key": "as-user","Value": "XXXXXXXXXXX"}]} ` to pass the user id and cache it. It creates issues when working with multiple copy and other operations. 

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

rclone should add an _as-user_ or any appropriate named key in Box type config section to store the user as it is using _impersonate_ for the google drive type config to store email. So it can be passed to headers from config section.
